items.content:
Please only apply if you are UK based, applicants from outside the UK cannot be considered. 
We prefer if you are based in Norwich or would be willing to relocate to Norwich.Intro
EHAB is a fast moving startup, combining distributed ledger technology and insurtech to de-risk construction contracts. Our mission is to remove aggravating admin and damaging disputes from the construction process and create a new way for companies to collaborate.


As an employer we will give you the opportunity to work on cutting edge tech, we invite you to contribute to the company in more ways than just work and most importantly we want you to develop personally and professionally as the team and company does.


Role
We're looking for a front-end developer, fluent in one of the major front-end frameworks (e.g. Angular, React, Vue) and experienced in web-design and UX. Ideally some experience with hybrid mobile frameworks (e.g. React Native, Ionic, etc).


More importantly, we're looking for someone who's comfortable navigating between multiple technologies, and open to work with whichever tool/framework/language is best suited to a given problem.


Requirements
Availability to start full time from the 1st of June / 2020
Fluent in one of the major front-end frameworks (e.g. Angular, React, Vue)
Experienced in web-design and UX
Ideally some experience with hybrid mobile frameworks (e.g. React Native, Ionic, etc)
Concerned with user experience, not just with code quality.
Takes initiative.
Professional, versatile and comfortable with agile methodologies.


The company
Work as part of an incredibly flexible and agile, multi-disciplinary team.
Career development opportunity as the company and team scales.
Flexi-working and remote working, offered and encouraged.
Chance to have more responsibility and contribute to the future of the company.


The technology
Working on technology which is defining the national and international standards for smart contracts in construction.
Developing solutions to problems that have yet to be tackled, in other words it’s cutting edge.
Numerous opportunities to work with and learn new skills and technologies.


Values
Great! You’ve read this far and you’re still reading. Now comes the final crux.


As a company we want to empower people to live their best life, to be curious and to flourish. We don’t want to work you to the bone, but we also expect high performance to be the norm. We want to be as flexible as we can to enable your way of life, as the happier you are the more likely we are to be a company that excels.


Ultimately we want to create an environment which is equally challenging, fun and supportive. We want to make a difference and cause a positive impact in the world, and we know we can't do that alone. We need a community of motivated and curious people to help us all get there.

items.title: Engineering Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=4, go=6, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=10, apple=2, java=1, gamedev=0, php=8, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Do you love building high performing teams? Do you have a passion for working with Product Managers to shape and deliver outstanding products for our customers? 


We’re Bloom & Wild, the UK’s most loved online florist. We’re using technology to reimagine the experience of buying and receiving flowers, connecting people more thoughtfully to make sending flowers a joy to send and a delight to receive. In doing so we're aiming to become Europe’s most loved flower brand. We’ve raised over £20million in venture capital funding and were recently named as the second-fastest growing tech company in the UK by Deloitte. One of the Tech Nation “Future Fifty” alumni and one of the Sunday Times Top 100 Small Companies to Work For 2020, we’re now the fastest growing online flower company in Europe.


Our business has, so far, been in the fortunate position to be able to continue trading and growing during this time of economic uncertainty, with the Government actively encouraging online retail, and customer demand for flowers for their loved ones is strong due to social distancing measures in place.


This is a great opportunity for a Software Engineering Manager with people management experience to lead two cross functional engineering squads. You will report to Steve, our VP Engineering who is extremely passionate about people development and scaling teams. You’ll get to shape both people and platforms to support our ambitious growth plans and take part in the next phase of our success.


In Technology we're split into three squads with a fourth on the way. You'll start by leading the Growth squad, which focuses on driving profitable customer acquisition across all of our markets.  This means helping to inspire our customers to understand, find, compare and select their perfect gift as well as working on improvements to our core checkout flow - delightfully expressing our brand to new customers and making it easy to order flowers. 


You’ll then play a leading part in the setup and day to day running of our new Expansion squad, with a mission to accelerate growth outside our UK core business. You’ll work closely with our VP of Business Development as the squad works on solutions that build our international markets, develop new distribution channels and support the development of new products and services.


About you


Building diverse, happy, high performing squads will be a key part of what you do. 


We believe strongly in giving our squads autonomy, while using cross team communities of practice and company wide OKRs to ensure alignment. You’ll need to be comfortable working at pace, while fostering a mindset of continuous improvement within the squad, evolving and extending the agile, iterative approach to meet the squad’s needs. 


You’ll play a leading part in delivering the product and technology roadmap, and ensuring that customer needs are at the forefront of the squad members minds. We favour a collaborative, data-driven and experimental approach to solving complex problems, and expect our Engineering Managers to foster this mindset in their squads. You’ll ensure that there is a focus on scrum mastery within your squad, either by playing the role yourself or empowering a squad member to assist you.


You’ll work closely with other Engineering Managers, VP Engineering and community of practice leads to shape the technology roadmap and strategy going forwards, ensuring that we are improving the whole team and optimising the approach for more than just your squad. 


Ideally your background will be in frontend development and this will enable you to help your squad interpret requirements into something they can deliver as you work with them to find the right technical approach. Working with our VP Engineering and Technology Leadership team, you’ll help to solve our top priority problems for the quarter from a technology and people perspective.


As an experienced people manager you’ll take responsibility for performance management, career progression, pastoral care and everything else that means that you have a happy and motivated squad. The team environment that you create will promote both autonomy and accountability. You’ll be a great coach and servant leader, able to motivate and guide the squad through the good times and the bad, learning and improving as you go. 


We care about creating a diverse and inclusive team - it's what helps us generate the best ideas and grow faster. We want to make giving and receiving gifts a joy for everyone, and to do this we need people from all backgrounds, with different perspectives and ideas. We welcome anyone to apply, with the knowledge that you’ll have the freedom to give your opinion, do your best work and be part of a genuinely inclusive, friendly and caring team.


Our tech


You’ll also get to work with some great technology. Our stack consists of iOS and Android apps, an Angular 7 website and backend platform in Ruby on Rails. We encourage our developers to be full stack and our squads to own their code from their local machine into usage in production. We’re focusing heavily on increasing our usage of machine learning and automation of our business processes so we can continue to scale at pace. You can read more about our technology over on our tech blog - Code & Wild.


Work environment


Currently our full team is working from home and adapting quickly to being totally remote. In addition to our normal perks and benefits we’re supporting each other and maintaining our culture remotely through:



  • Regular virtual yoga classes with more virtual exercise variety to come!

  • Celebrating birthdays with letterbox cake

  • Weekly ‘team drinks trolleys’ and updates from our senior team

  • Remote lunch and learns

  • Supporting our wellbeing through online support sessions and employee assistance program

  • New slack channels and ways of communicating including wellbeing channels

  • Specialist online support to talk about the challenges we are facing in the current environment


When we’re in the office:


Our lovely, light and spacious office is conveniently located close to Vauxhall and Oval stations in London. We have an informal, startup culture, with employee-friendly policies such as:



  • 25 days holiday, with an additional day off for your birthday, plus bank holidays, totalling 34 days, per annum

  • Free breakfast, snacks and team lunches

  • Season ticket loan

  • Childcare Vouchers

  • Health cash plan through Simplyhealth

  • Personal Development Budget

  • Family Friendly Policy - including enhanced family friendly packages  and a salary sacrifice childcare scheme

  • Pension Contribution

  • Cycle to Work Scheme

  • Lunch & Learns

  • Discounted blooms

  • Bloom & Go Wild trips - most recently we went to Paris!


We apply our five key values (delight, customer first, care, innovation and pride) in our day to day activities and reward those who are encompassing them exceptionally. Everyone is friendly and sociable, with regular company-wide events.


Before you start you’ll be able to choose whatever laptop you need, a widescreen monitor to plug into and whatever other tools you need.


But why take our word for it? This video gives you a real insight into what it’s like to work at Bloom & Wild https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AhLIQv_sdHw 


Our recruitment process


The interview process consists of a thirty minute phone call with Steve, our VP Engineering. Given the current situation in the UK due to COVID-19 then this will be followed by a series of remote interviews. During this time you’d get the chance to meet with some of the squad, talk with our VP Engineering Steve and Product Manager Faris and find out what it’s like to work for Europe’s fastest growing online flower company.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=10}
items.content:
Front End Developer with UX Skills


Remote - full time 


Tech stack: HTML, CSS, Javascript and UX skills 


Who are we? 


At Think Huge Ltd, we’ve grown 30% in both headcount and revenue, year on year, since our 2012 inception.


We’re renowned for our Forex Trading software and for our online security tools. We have several multi-million pound B2C brands, all in the technology industry and we plan to triple the business in the next 3 years.


As such, we’re on the hunt for a sharp Front End Developer to join our expanding development team and come with us on our growth mission!


Who are you? 



  • A nerd that admires beautifully functional websites

  • Highly competent in HTML5/CSS3 and JavaScript & Node

  • Highly attentive to detail and can accurately code up designs provided.

  • Fantastic communicator and a self starter who's willing to contribute ideas to get the job done.

  • Fluent in English


You will: 



  • Have experience developing and designing websites with user experience and conversion optimisation as the core objective

  • The ability to demonstrate a past track record of success with portfolio examples

  • Enjoy working remotely and have excellent communication skills


Why join our team? 



  • We’re expecting to rapidly expand the business over the next 3 years - we love growth!



  • Work remotely - we have no office and never will. We have over 30 people working around the world at Think Huge and it works!



  • We invest significantly in both external and internal training, providing opportunities for our staff to learn and grow throughout their career with us

  • Work when you are most productive. If that's morning, night or something in between, we care about getting the job done, not punching a clock. We also offer up to 4 weeks paid leave per year, because everyone needs a break.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=15, bigdata-ml=5, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=18}
items.content:
Senior Software Engineer


London, UK/Remote


We are looking for a senior software engineer who values code as a craft to help us build out our digital model of the construction industry, fed with real-time data.


At Converge you can be certain that you will work on a well-engineered codebase written by a team who cares. We value high-quality code but understand how important it is to get things done, rather than perfect.


We deeply value collaborative work. Careful code-reviews, well-written tests, and beautifully written code ensure that our customers will get an amazing product delivered, which is safe and delightful to use.

We're a small, multicultural, and close bunch, which means that everyone can have a big impact on what we do, from how our platform looks, to how our sensors work.


Converge has already achieved a lot in more than 200 sites across the world, and we look forward to having you with us so that we can do even more and continue to scale globally.


About the role


You will be engaged in the rapid development of several new products in 2020 alone, with exposure to the existing portfolio too, helping to scale those products internationally.


Key Responsibilities



  • Develop and maintain our APIs and backend services

  • Implement UIs and maintain our client-side applications, including a mobile app and a web platform

  • Reviewing other team members' code

  • Work closely with product and design teams to flesh out features and requirements

  • Collaborate with the hardware team to bring amazing new products to life

  • Monitor, troubleshoot, and provide support for our applications

  • Automating repetitive tasks (let the machines do it!)

  • Write thorough software tests: unitary, integration, and E2E.


You should have:



  • At least 5 years of experience developing and shipping code professionally

  • A solid understanding of JavaScript

  • Excellent understanding and professional experience applying testing practices (TDD, Exploratory Testing, E2E tests)

  • In-depth understanding of relational databases (preferably Postgres)

  • Detailed understanding of how to use Git in a team setting

  • Experience working in an environment that embraces a DevOps culture

  • Experience with agile methodologies


It would be nice if you have:



  • Previous experience in the IoT sector

  • Mobile development experience

  • Experience building data processing pipelines for time-series data


Our Stack



  • Node.js, Typescript, React, Redux, Postgres, Python, RabbitMQ, React Native, Docker, Ansible, DigitalOcean, AWS.


Learn more about our team, benefits and perks on our careers page!

Hi there!


We're Foodorama, a platform for showcasing and discovering restaurant menus.


We are a London based startup looking for a front end developer to join our mission to provide a world-class digital menu to let people discover their perfect meal through visual, interactive and tailored menus.


Location

What We're Looking For


The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, testing, and debugging our responsive web application.
Using React, Redux, TypeScript, HTML, and CSS, this candidate will be able to translate user and business needs into functional frontend design.

items.content:
Application link: https://grnh.se/1d4e63c22us


Hello!


Thanks for taking a look at the job description for a Chief Architect at Impala. We felt a little bit impersonal just throwing you right in there with words like “revolutionizing” and “disrupting”.


As such, we want you to know that the person that wrote this job description apologises in advance for any clichés, startup tropes or sudden-insecurity-driven-panic-attacks that you might find in the description below.


What is Impala now?


Impala makes building travel software incredibly easy. We provide hotels with a powerful data management platform that makes connecting to software, hardware and room distributors extremely easy. Think Twilio for Travel.


We launched in January 2019 and since then have grown at - quite frankly - a ridiculous pace. Our technology is already installed in hundreds of hotels worldwide, on six continents and categorises more than 1 billion data points.


We are a growing team of exceptional people split across engineering, product and commercial that have built a fantastic, remote-but-far-from-distant community.


Where is Impala going?


We’re supported by some of the best investors in the business, the early stage backers behind Deliveroo, PillPack, SecretEscapes, Zoopla, Trivago and more. They’re on board because of our vision - revolutionizing a $1.6 trillion dollar market that’s been out-of-date for 20 years.


Within the next two years, 25% of hotel bookings worldwide will flow through Impala technology and the product that we’re building will empower the entire ecosystem of travel technology (we already have over a thousand companies signed up).


Anyone travelling anywhere will interact with products powered by Impala and to achieve this we’re growing the team to 50 people within the next year. So now is the most exciting time to be joining Impala as we go through a large push to scale up!


A brief overview of what you’ll be up to in this role:


As chief architect, you will act as the technical authority in a top-tier engineering team, ensuring that our technology can meet both immediate and future needs. You will report to (and work alongside) our VP of Engineering. 


Technology sits at the heart of our business, which makes this a pivotal role with key responsibilities: 



  • You will lead on technology strategy & prioritization, managing short term technical risks and long term investment in our stack

  • You will be accountable for technical quality at Impala, including the reliability, security, and extensibility of our services and data 

  • You will ensure that monitoring, metrics and SRE practices are in place across all teams and services, to measure and meet high service SLA’s / expectations 

  • You will be the direct leader of an enablement group, which provides specialist  technical/DevOps/SecOps support to our development teams

  • You will provide technical direction and mentorship across teams to support the development of individuals 


You should join us if: 



  • You have 10+ years of relevant and diverse product and engineering experience, with a period of executive-level responsibility at an organization with a strong engineering culture

  • You are an expert in the architectural design, development, and operation of large scale, high availability services 

  • You have demonstrated experience with modern web services, distributed service-oriented architectures and services that handle large quantities of data, across multiple different stacks. 

  • You aren’t afraid to get hands-on when necessary to demonstrate an approach / principle 

  • You are comfortable leading and mentoring teams and individuals


Where in the world will you be working?


This is a remote position. This means you can work from anywhere +/- 2 Hours of London, timezone wise (and less than a 3 hour flight).We are a remote-first company, our whole engineering team is fully distributed! This was a very deliberate choice to prioritise work-life balance and ensure we’re able to accommodate the best people in Europe. We have loads of remote initiatives to ensure you’re fully setup!:



  • We give you an additional generous Personalised Workspace Budget for things like monitors, keyboards, desk chairs and headphones.

  • We offer an office stipend (you can furnish a home office with a generous monthly stipend, or choose a co-working space near you).

  • You’ll travel once a quarter to meet and socialise with the rest of the engineering team somewhere in Europe.

  • You’ll have a generous Social Budget to travel to London based social events. You'll also have a special 'Loved Ones Budget' that we're incredibly proud to offer, we'll tell you more about that when we speak to you!

  • We have a dedicated Remote Experience Manager in the team, who, amongst other things, will be ensuring you're happy, integrated and empowered whilst working remotely.

  • We will give you a brand new high-spec laptop when you start, giving you the choice between a Thinkpad or Mac.


Please note, we only accept candidates in Western Europe because of timezone and travel time differences. We make no exceptions (we don’t have time to!).


What you’ll get if you join us: 



  • We’re in the top 14% of companies in the UK for holiday that we offer, at 36 days - so you’ll have plenty of time to rest and recharge

  • We also offer Impalans one Unsick day per year, so you can proactively look after your health (time to finally book that dentist appointment!)

  • Impala believes that great people should be able to focus on developing mastery of their skills, even if they don’t want to manage people. Here you’ll be able to access 3.5x the average annual raise, even staying in the same role.

  • We put our money where our mouth is when it comes to investing in your development - you’ll have access to a generous yearly learning budget to help you realise your potential. 

  • We offer all engineers a Weekly Recess Hour. This is an hour to take off and step out from work and invest in You Time! Lawn mow, yoga, walk or movie anyone?

  • We offer an extended lunch break option, meaning you can take an extra hour lunch break, and we trust you to make up for it later in the day.

  • We offer a stipend to set up your ideal place of work. You can choose between the option of £150 per month to build out your home office, or we’ll pay for your membership at a coworking space near you up to £350.

  • In addition, we give you a special Personalised Workspace Equipment budget for things like monitors, keyboards, headphones or desk chairs.

  • You’ll travel once a quarter to meet the rest of the team in an engineer colocation week, somewhere in Europe.

  • You’ll have a Social Budget to travel to/from & stay in London for a night, for our monthly Impala Social.

  • You’ll have a generous Friend & Family Budget, to get your close friends and family over once a year.

  • We’ll organise socials around your area with other remote workers. 

  • We have a Health & Wellbeing scheme in place, offering you the option of a monthly gym membership reimbursement each month, or a health food voucher each month; access to Headspace; Vitality health insurance (UK only); plus the chance to win a massage monthly. Plus loads more.

  • Perkbox. A platform designed to help you to live a better life by personalising, managing, delivering and measuring the best company perks in real-time. 

  • You’ll be working somewhere that encourages collaboration, is transparent, has a strong focus on wellbeing, and doesn’t just pay lip service to it’s Core Values.


Sound interesting? 


If you are excited to learn more then please check out our Medium page which includes more information about who we are, what we do, what matters to us, and our culture.


Want to know more about our CEO, or want a deeper understanding of our what and why? Watch this video. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nxBZuoxCbKM

items.content:
Application link: https://grnh.se/796b906e2us


Hello!


Thanks for checking out our job description for a remote Senior Frontend Engineer at Impala. We felt a little bit impersonal just throwing you right in there with words like “revolutionizing” and “disrupting”.


As such, we want you to know that the person that wrote this job description apologises in advance for any clichés, tropes or sudden-insecurity-driven-panic-attacks that you might find in the description below.


 


What is Impala?


Impala makes building travel software incredibly easy. We provide hotels with a powerful data management platform that makes connecting to software, hardware and room distributors extremely easy. Think Twilio for Travel.


We launched the product in January 2019 and since then have grown at - quite frankly - a ridiculous old clip. Our technology is already installed in hundreds of hotels worldwide, on six continents and categorises more than 1 billion data points.


We are a growing team of exceptional people split across engineering, product and commercial that have built a fantastic community.


 


Where is Impala going?


We’re supported by some of the best investors in the business, the early-stage backers behind Deliveroo, PillPack, SecretEscapes, Zoopla, Trivago, Monzo, Travelperk, Transferwise, Airbnb, GetYourGuide, Omio, Spotify and more! 


They’re on board because of the opportunity that lies before us - revolutionizing a 1.6 trillion dollar market that’s been out-of-date for 20 years.


They also share our vision of democratising travel and enabling innovation across the industry.


Within the next two years, 25% of hotel bookings worldwide will flow through Impala technology and the product that we’re building will support the entire ecosystem of travel technology (we already have over a thousand companies signed up).


Anyone travelling anywhere will interact with products powered by Impala and to achieve this we’re growing the team extensively within the next year. Now is the most exciting time to be joining Impala as we go through a large push to scale up!


 


A brief overview of what you will be doing here:


You will act as a technical authority for the frontend services, ensuring a high level of quality for both our code and our user experience. You will be a key contributor to emerging products in our new distribution platform. Your job will involve analysing and optimising the product and technical performance of features to continually improve customer experience.


 


You should join us if you:



  • Have expert ability with ReactJS and strong knowledge of JS fundamentals

  • Have experience leading the development of significant frontend projects (feature-rich customer tools, multi-team contribution).

  • Are comfortable working closely with product owners, designers, UX experts and the ability to translate their designs/requirements into maintainable, componentised UIs.

  • Have experience with the design and consumption of REST APIs.

  • Are fully capable across the stack, able to build out or contribute to backend services where necessary.

  • You are extremely collaborative, Impala’s engineering team is not political, everyone has great ideas and should be open to input. We have no space for brilliant jerks.

  • You are passionate about customer experience and building high-quality maintainable software that looks and works fantastically.


 


Where will you work?


This is a remote position. This means you can work from anywhere +/- 2 Hours of London timezone (and less than a 3 hour flight).

 

We are a remote-first company, our whole engineering team is fully distributed! This was a very deliberate choice to prioritise work-life balance and ensure we’re able to accommodate the best people in Europe, whilst fostering diversity.

 

We have loads of remote initiatives to ensure you’re fully setup !


  • We give you an additional generous Personalised Workspace Budget for things like monitors, keyboards, desk chairs and headphones.

  • We offer an office stipend - you can furnish your home office with a generous £150 monthly stipend (coffee, snacks, wifi bills, cleaning, desk equipment, plus anything in between) or we will pay for a co-working membership near you.

  • You’ll travel once a quarter to meet and socialise with the rest of the engineering team somewhere in Europe.

  • You’ll have a generous Social Budget to travel to London based social events.

  • You'll also have a special 'Loved Ones Budget' that we're incredibly proud to offer - £750 per year to visit your friends and family, no matter how near or far from home you are based.

  • We have a dedicated Remote Experience Manager in the team, who's role amongst other things, is to ensure your happiness, and help you integrate and be empowered whilst working remotely.

  • We will give you a brand new high-spec laptop when you start, giving you the choice between a Thinkpad or Mac.


Please note, we only accept candidates in Western Europe because of timezone and travel time differences. We make no exceptions (we don’t have time to!). 

 


What you will get in return? 



  • We reward Impalans with super competitive salaries and regular reviews. Whether you're an individual contributor or you want to manage people, there's plenty of opportunity to develop your skills and boost your earning potential. We offer 3.5x the average annual raise in the UK, even if you remain within the same role.

  • We’re in the top 14% of companies in the UK for holiday that we offer, at 36 days.

  • One Unsick day off per year, to keep up with proactive health admin - so you can finally sort that trip to the dentist and get those health screens that you never have time to do.

  • A stipend to set up your ideal place of work. You can choose between the option of £150 per month to build out your home office, or we’ll pay for your membership at a coworking space near you up to £350.

  • Truly flexible working. Work remotely, with a budget given to you to set up your workspace in the way you want. We also offer extended lunch break options, Recess Hour, and loads more. No commutes no more!

  • Sustainable growth and career progression opportunities.

  • We invest in your development with a generous £1,000 Professional Development budget per year, and we will support you to realise your potential. 

  • Fun and inclusive monthly social events, from go-karting to mini golf to karaoke, giving Impalans across Europe the chance to catch up and recharge.

  • Access to Perkbox - a platform designed to help you to live a better life by personalising, managing, delivering and measuring the best company perks in real-time.  

  • A super strong and pro-active focus on mental and physical wellbeing. Our Health and Wellbeing scheme offers Impalans a range of options; from Vitality health insurance, to Sanctus, to a monthly gym membership reimbursement, plus heaps more.

  • We've got meaningful core values which we don't just pay lip service to.

  • A Weekly Recess Hour; take an hour off to step out from work and invest in You Time! Lawn mow, yoga, walk or movie anyone?

  • A Social Budget to travel to/from & stay in London for a night, for our monthly Impala Social.

  • A generous Loved Ones Budget, to get your friends & family over to visit you once a year, no matter how near or far from home you are based.

  • Weekly 20% Time.


 


Sound interesting? 


If your answer is yes and you are really excited to learn more then please check out our Medium page which includes more information about who we are, what we do, what matters to us, and our culture.


Want to know more about our CEO, or want a deeper understanding of our what and why? Watch this video. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nxBZuoxCbKM


For more information about what it's like working here, check out our Glassdoor page.

items.content:
Full-stack Developer needed for a pre-seed startup on an exciting mission to support businesses and customers on their transformation to be more ethical using influencer marketing using an innovative, tech-driven B2B2C model.


We have defined our vision and initial roadmap and are now building out our MVP platform. We identified the requirement for a second developer ... YOU! 


Are you experienced with one or several of: 



  • PHP7 and web development frameworks (Symfony / MVC)

  • Strong experience of frontend technology (Angular / React),

  • MySQL

  • Comfortable with API-driven development

  • Cloud technologies (AWS, ElasticSearch, Digital Ocean)


Initially this role will be equity-based (as for everyone at Pinfluencer) but we’re fast-moving and things look to be quite different in just a few months. You will join a fun but focused remote team of 3x founders and 1x developer.


This is truly an exciting and possibly life-changing opportunity for someone with the skills and vision. If this sounds interesting, let’s chat!


 


-----


AGENCIES: Sorry, this isn’t for you - we’re hiring directly for this role

items.content:
Senior Full Stack Developer (f/m/x) - Full-time in Berlin


Our mission at HeavenHR is to provide the only software, businesses need to manage their human resources. Our goal is to help companies save time and focus on what they are really good at. From onboarding to payroll, we connect all separate HR processes into a single and easy-to-use platform.


HeavenHR is a SaaS start-up, founded in 2015 and backed by well-known VC funds and experienced business angels. We have recently closed our Series B funding. To continue our rapid growth, we are looking for a Senior Full Stack Developer (f/m/x) who enjoys working in a dynamic environment and wants to join us in developing our great software further.


Your duties:



  • As an experienced software developer you are responsible for the guiding of your teammates as well as contributing to software technical know-how and educating best practices



  • Contribute to make our easy-to-use platform a great user experience

  • Ensure accessibility, usability and performance of our application

  • Optimize website responsiveness for mobile and tablet

  • Build an excellent product on a technical and qualitative level

  • Be responsible for delivering sustainable and high quality code

  • You’re up to date with the world’s newest technologies and keen to implement and evolve them with us


Your background:



  • Bachelor's or Master's in Computer science or a related technical field

  • 6+ years of experience in building web applications

  • Enjoyment for being a generalist working on both frontend, backend and anything it takes to solve problems and delight our users

  • Very good knowledge of ReactJS, as well as backend technologies such as Java. It comes in handy if you’ve already worked with a microservices setup

  • Working experience in CI/CD is a plus

  • Proactive, goal-oriented, energetic with an independent way of working

  • Fluent in English


Our Heaven includes:



  • Opportunity to work in an agile environment with lean processes (fast and small iterations)

  • A choice to work from Mac, Windows, or Linux

  • An HR tech product that makes our customers’ life easier

  • Access to HeavenHR’s public transport ticket (BVG)

  • Constant supply of coffee, mate, water, beer and other soft drinks. On top of that we provide you with fresh fruits every week to provide you with your vitamins and keep you healthy.

  • Regular office parties and other team events

  • Oh, not to forget: our dog-friendly office loft is based in Berlin’s hip Bergmannkiez, Kreuzberg


________________________________________________________________________________


HeavenHR COVID-19 Announcement:


Dear Motivated Applicant,


Looking for an opportunity during these unsure times? We welcome you!


At HeavenHR we have taken safety precautions when it comes to our employees and have all of us work remotely. The health of candidates that apply with us, is also very important to us, thus we are conducting all interviews by video call or by phone.


We look forward to seeing your application.


Sincerely,


Your friends at HeavenHR


____________________________________________________________________________________


Did we get your attention?


We are looking forward to receiving your application! Please include


- Your CV


-Salary expectations


-The earliest starting date


In case you are not an EU citizen, we also need copies of your academic degree & valid passport.


If you have a Blue Card, Visa or Work Permit- please provide us with a copy.


We can't wait to hear from you!

Lead UI Frontend Engineer | React JS Developer (m/f/x) - Full-time in Berlin


Our mission at HeavenHR is to provide the only software, businesses need to manage their human resources. Our goal is to help companies save time and focus on what they are really good at. From onboarding to payroll, we connect all separate HR processes into a single and easy-to-use platform.


HeavenHR is a SaaS start-up, founded in 2015 and backed by well-known VC funds and experienced business angels. We have recently closed our Series B funding. To continue our rapid growth, we are looking for a Lead UI Frontend Engineer | React JS Developer (m/f/x) who enjoys working in a dynamic environment and wants to join us in developing our great software further.


Your duties:



  • Keen on technically leading the team , be a hands on facilitator between Senior and UI Developers.

  • Motivated to make our easy-to-use platform a great user experience for customers and for our HeavenHR employees (we use our own product!)

  • Ensure accessibility, usability and performance of our application

  • Optimize website responsiveness for mobile and tablet

  • Build an excellent product on a technical and qualitative level

  • Initiate the development of new processes and solutions, realizing own ideas and shaping your own way of working


Your background:



  • Bachelor's or Master's in Computer Science or a related technical field

  • 7+ years of experience in building web applications

  • Very good knowledge of JavaScript and ReactJS

  • Experience with Web Standards (HTML5, CSS3)

  • Working experience in CI/CD is a plus

  • Proactive, goal-oriented, energetic with an independent way of working

  • Fluent in English



Our Heaven includes:



  • Be part of a consistently growing tech team with everyday opportunity to learn, grow and develop

  • A choice to work from Mac, Windows or Linux

  • An international (14+ nations) team of smart and enthusiastic people

  • We got you covered for retirement and offer a company pension scheme

  • Discounted public transportation ticket for the Berlin area

  • 24 day vacation budget to start with, adding 2 per year, capped at 30 days

  • We offer a constant supply of coffee, mate, water, beer, fruit baskets, veggies and a variety of snacks to keep you healthy. Once a month, we have an office party with yummy food!

  • Moving from a different country? We can assist with the visa paperwork

  • Oh, not to forget: our dog-friendly office is based in Berlin’s Bergmannkiez, the heart of Kreuzberg!


_______________________________________________________________________________________________


HeavenHR COVID-19 Announcement:


Dear Motivated Applicant,


Looking for an opportunity during these unsure times? We welcome you!


At HeavenHR we have taken safety precautions when it comes to our employees and have all of us work remotely. The health of candidates that apply with us, is also very important to us, thus we are conducting all interviews by video call or by phone.


We look forward to seeing your application.


Sincerely, 
Your friends at HeavenHR


________________________________________________________________________________________________


 


Did we get your attention?


We are looking forward to receiving your application! Please include


- Your CV


-Salary expectations


-The earliest starting date


In case you are not an EU citizen, we also need copies of your academic degree & valid passport.


If you have a Blue Card, Visa or Work Permit- please provide us with a copy.


We can't wait to hear from you!

items.content:
The company


Maison Sport is the platform for independent ski and snowboard instructors in The Alps. Our mission is to connect skiers and snowboarders with amazing, independent instructors, whilst enabling the instructors to increase their earnings and work in a more flexible way.


The Job


We are looking for a lead backend web developer to help improve and scale our platform. You’ll build your own team of developers to help you drive our ambitious goals for the product.  You'll need to have a track record of creating and maintaining interactive web apps, delivering high-quality software and guiding/mentoring fellow team members.


As the lead developer, you will be responsible for the strategic development of the platform – whether that’s codebase language, application architecture or hosting infrastructure. 


This is a brilliant opportunity to take an existing, successful, live web application to the next level. 


Responsibilities


Owning the development, testing, deployment and technical strategy of Maison Sport.


Building out and leading the Maison Sport technical team, in a hands-on development capacity.


Technical Skills



  • PHP 7 or Ruby

  • Highly proficient in HTML5, CSS, JavaScript.

  • Working knowledge of React.js

  • AWS and Continuous Deployment

  • Browser testing and multi-browser/multi-platform compatibility

  • Familiarity with accessibility standards

  • Strong grasp of data protection and web application security principles

  • Strong experience of implementing and managing payment processors

  • Agile software development experience


Personal Skills



  • Good interpersonal skills, for managing and mentoring other team members.

  • Comfortable interpreting, analysing and discussing project requirements with the wider Maison Sport team.

  • Open to learning new technologies and methodologies

  • Understand the basics of user experience and user-centric design

  • Excellent spoken and written English.


Benefits



  • Competitive Salary

  • 25 days of paid annual leave + bank holidays

  • Additional leave for professional development

  • Work from home on Fridays

  • Team ski/snowboard trip

  • Share options in the company


To Apply


Minimum of 2+ years of commercial experience. Salary is subject to location London/Edinburgh and experience. To be considered for this job you must have valid documentation to live and work in the UK.

items.content:
Location: Sheffield Office/ Home Based


Job Type: Contract or Full Time (30 hours per week)


Coordinate Sport is a web application designed with sports and activity providers in mind. We already work with many of the leading Sports Activity Providers, Premiership Football Club Foundation Trusts and Schools across the UK. We provide our customers with tools to help them keep track of their equipment, take bookings in an instant and effortlessly coordinate members of their coaching staff using our customisable web application.


The Full Stack Developer will have experience developing web applications. This position requires a developer with the skills and experience in building modern web applications using the latest back-end and front-end technologies.


Provide professional advice on technology evolutions and suggestions for future direction regarding the uptake of new technologies and software as they become available. Will be involved in software development end-to-end, which may include backlog refinement, analysis, design, development, testing, release and 3rd line support.


Role


A talented Full Stack Developer is sought to work with the Operations Manager and colleagues to shape the product design and implement our vision.


Continue to develop our application, platform and product range. It will require full stack development with an emphasis on user interface and ease of use.


Develop projects from concept through to creation with the ability to continually bring new ideas to support the creation of unique experiences.


Experience



  • Proven experience as a full stack developer or in a similar role.

  • Experience developing web, mobile, theme and API integrations.

  • Knowledge of multiple front-end languages and libraries (e.g. HTML/ CSS, JavaScript, XML, jQuery).

  • Knowledge of multiple back-end languages (e.g. PHP, Java, Python) and JavaScript frameworks (e.g. Angular, React, Node.js).


Experience of the following would be advantageous:



  • PHP (7+)

  • Codeigniter 3 Framework           

  • HTML/CSS

  • Bootstrap

  • BitBucket

  • Javascript/jQuery

  • Wordpress

  • AWS

  • IOS & Android


Excellent written and verbal communication skills are required for this role. Great attention to detail and organisational skills and ability to work well within a team.


Ownership and communication are also key. We are looking for people who care deeply about the code they write whilst at the same time helping to bridge the gap between the technical and the business areas of the company effectively. As we also provide products to educational based organisations and charities you should be a person who cares deeply about the human aspect of our products.


Benefits



  • Flexible Working Hours

  • Home or Office Based Locations

items.content:
About the company 


Be part of something exciting!  We are developing an app to help people work more collaboratively and effectively from home integrating into application like Zoom, Slack and Hangouts. 


We are looking for a Developer that can come on board and help us build this innovative application that will revolutionize the way people work. 


OrangeMaple offers a competitive compensation package with opportunities for growth and professional development. Flexible hours and remote working possibilities are offered as part of this role as well as other excellent benefits including pension schemes. 


The role



  • Create a best-in-class product to revolutionize a market

  • Be a part of customer and expert meetings to inform and define the product direction 

  • Build a beautiful and functional front-end that customers love using 

  • Help develop our web platform APIs & from the ground up 

  • Build reusable code and libraries for future use 

  • Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs 

  • Be responsible for maintaining, expanding, and scaling our product 

  • Designing databases and data storage structures 

  • Deploy production code 


You'll have 



  • Advanced experience in Node.js 

  • Advanced experience in JavaScript framework like EmberJS, or Angular, React and willing to learn. 

  • Experience building / using RESTful APIs 

  • Proficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them. 

  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools  

  • Excellent verbal communication skills 

  • Good problem-solving skills 

  • Experience with AWS Infrastructure & console 


Benefits 



  • 25 days holiday plus bank holidays 

  • Pension with up to 5% contribution matching 

  • Flexible working hours  

  • Remote working  

  • Bring your dog to the office 

  • Office snacks, coffee, fruits

We’re solving a global issue worth $1 trillion loss of health productivity as a small London team from IBM, NHS and PWC using machine learning. Our mission and community have since grown stronger, so we are now building a team of rockstar engineers to support our growth and scale plans. We are looking for a passionate technical lead engineer with strong front/backend skills and experience in shipping quality applications ideally with JavaScript/React native.


Benefits



  • Competitive Package

  • Equity incentive

  • Flexible remote/work-life balance inc vacations

  • International travel opportunity

  • An energetic team with flat hierarchy

  • High growth with opportunity for career development

  • WeWork’s Central London tech community

  • Wellness/mentor plans

  • Free fruit, breakfast, coffee and beer

  • Shower and bike locker in the office Tasks


We are looking for a rockstar software engineer to play the key role in our React Native developments to help us ship quality product and upgrades.




  • Must have at least 3 years experience of React Native development


    • Experience in integrating Swift/Objective-C/Java libraries with React Native


    • Substantial JavaScript experience


    • A history of working within an Agile product delivery environment


    • Strong understanding of best practice coding standards developing high quality, testable and performant software using agile practices such as pair programming and TDD


    • Real-word experience of a truly agile delivery model and an appreciation for a test-driven, code-review culture.


    • Participating in story definition, assisting QA's and business stakeholders with Acceptance criteria




Please reply for an immediate online interview.

Full Stack Developer - Immediate Start / Profitable Company / Remote working possible.


We're a 30 person fintech company located in Shoreditch and have two immediate openings (we help SME's apply for finance and COVID-19 means we're growing at 20% week on week for the foreseeable future).


This is a full time permanent position. You would be working with our tech team from our offices 5 minutes from Liverpool Street but in the current circumstances remote working is possible.


If you're looking for an organisation that is methodical in its approach to technical development but where where your work goes live quickly and is used by thousands of SME's a month we should talk. We're looking for the following



  • 3+ years experience working with Javascript.

  • 2+ years experience building responsive web applications in React and Redux.

  • UI/UX development and design.

  • Knowledge of SSR framework

  • Experience with Javascript build tools such as NPM (or similar).

  • Experience


Additional desirable experience

Skills Required:



  • React

  • Redux

  • SASS

items.content:
Everymind at Work are taking great strides in helping to normalise mental health conversations in the workplace. Our business is driven by our app helping employees manage their wellbeing through tailored content and a series of in-app features.


We currently have our product to market and are now looking for a driven developer with the energy and drive to help take our technology and business to the next level. The MVP was built by a London based agency, who will be available for the first few months handover


This is an opportunity to join an early stage business and help mould the landscape of how wellbeing in the workplace looks in the future.


This will be our first in-house hire but as we grow there will be an opportunity to help build out the team. We are looking for someone to join us in our offices, so the applicant will need to be able to commute to our London offices.


Skills Required:



  •  JavaScript ES6+,

  •  React

  •  React Native

  •  TypeScript

  •  GraphQL, Apollo Client, Apollo Server

  •  SQL (PostgreSQL)

  • Other tools and technologies: - Yarn, Lerna, GIT, CircleCI, App Center, Styled Components, Knex, Serverless, AWS


Key responsibilities:



  • Ownership of the entire development process to ensure targets are met.

  • Communicating with both technical and non-technical members of our team.

  • Ensure you and others continuously improve by proposing and then implementing new processes, designs and engineering practices that make us more effective.


Successful candidates will ideally have:



  • Lots of enthusiasm 

  • Strong communication skills

  • A flexible approach to work, and be OK with the ambiguity that comes with a new business learning fast

  • Comfortable sharing ideas and desire to help grow the business


Benefits of working with Everymind at Work:



  • Competitive salary based on experience

  • Flexible/remote working options for developers

  • Options Pool available after 6 months

  • Working for a new startup, your work will have a big impact on the business and our customers

  • Working in an agile team

  • Central London office

  • Company focused on employee happiness. Practice what we preach.

  • Making a difference in the world

items.content:
Cloud Academy

 

Sr Back End Engineer

PLEASE NOTE: This is a 100% remote position for candidates in Europe who speak fluent English and Italian and are willing and able to spend one week per quarter in our Swiss office with the Engineering team (travel expenses covered). Cloud Academy is the leading digital skills development platform that enables every enterprise to become a tech company through guided Learning Paths, Hands-on Labs, and Skill Assessment. Cloud Academy delivers role-specific training on leading clouds (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform), essential methodologies needed to operate on and between clouds (DevOps, security, containers), and capabilities that are unlocked by the cloud (big data, machine learning). Companies like Turner, Cognizant, SAS, and ThermoFisher customize Cloud Academy to contextualize learning and leverage the platform to assign, manage, and measure cloud enablement at scale. Now is your chance to join our talented team that delivers unparalleled educational content to developers worldwide! We’re looking for a remote Senior Back-End Engineer to help us take our product to the next level. We move seamlessly from full-stack web development, to mobile, to deployment/scaling. This position will take ownership of how features are implemented, from user experience to backend, involving our web app, mobile app, APIs and backend infrastructure. You’ll have an opportunity to make a large impact on the culture of our development team. Our ideal candidate is a humble leader, equally capable of teaching and learning. Responsibilities: * Able to write well-structured, maintainable, idiomatic code with good documentation; unit tests for every feature, bug fixing and code reviews. * Communicate with the rest of the company (e.g. sales, marketing, UX, etc) to ensure the functionality you're implementing is what was intended. * Collaborate in a cross-functional team, including mobile developers, designers and product managers in order to quickly deliver new features. * Work closely with the Operations Team to ensure smooth deployments, ensuring that errors are logged with enough info to debug effectively. Requirements: * Passion for coding, web technologies, and shipping features that drive users adoption. * Strong understanding of server-side technologies such as: Python, Django, Flask, Celery and both Relational and NoSQL databases: PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis * Advanced knowledge and experience on modern web patterns: AJAX, RESTful APIs, SOA, WebSocket, client-side rendering, etc. * Understanding of client-side technologies: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, Bootstrap, Web Components, * Experience with distributed version control systems: mostly Git (Github and/or Bitbucket). * Familiar with cloud-oriented technologies: AWS, Google Cloud, Heroku, Docker * Familiar with cloud architecture patterns and best practices for designing highly available, scalable and secure systems. * Good level of English proficiency, both spoken and written. * Ability to work independently and as part of a team, with a sense of urgency and integrity. Benefits: * Competitive compensation with annual bonus potential * Budget for professional development * 4 weeks paid vacation per year * 15 paid holidays per year * Great company culture and work environment! * Highly-skilled teammates and lots of opportunities for growth and development!

items.content:
Everclear

 

Senior Software Engineer

This is an opportunity to join a small team of extremely talented engineers responsible for the technical strategy and implementation of the company's core revenue-driving products.  Our team has only senior level engineers.  We pride ourselves on being pragmatic, open minded, process driven, and guided by established best practices.  We have dedicated Product, DevOps, and QA teams supporting us. We’re looking for someone who: * Prides themselves on being a top performer * Wants to become an integral part of a small upbeat engineering team that’s having fun building things, and to push them to do even better! * Knows good design, who’s not scared by scaling. * Can take a project spec and run with it (but knows that discussing design with the team before running too far is the better move). Requirements: * 5+ Years of software development experience with Ruby on Rails * 5+ Years of software development with React or similar front end frameworks * You must be curious and an excellent problem solver * Full Stack development experience is required * Experience with launching and scaling products in a production environment is required * Experience working with telephony and video platforms is a plus * Experience working 100% remote is a plus Compensation: * Competitive Salary - Just ask! * Great Health/dental vision insurance * 401K (with matching) * Work/life balance (we're profitable - we don't want to burn out) * Flexible Schedule * Generous Paid Time Off Policies * The software and equipment you need to be productive, including a new MacBook Pro A glimpse into daily life: * Spend time figuring out how to implement a ticket * Chat with the team on Slack or pair with someone on Zoom as a sounding board * Branch your Git fork, code up a solution, and create a pull request * Thanks to devops magic, docker, jenkins and kubernetes you now have a staging environment with your changes, along with unit and integration test feedback. * Test your solution and then request a senior engineer review your code before passing it along to the QA team. * If it’s Friday, hang out and have a drink with 30+ of your coworkers on Zoom

items.content:
REPAY

 

Full Stack Developer

REPAY – Realtime Electronic Payments is an established and fast growing, Financial Technology company. We build great software that enables businesses to move faster by removing friction in payments processing by offering a comprehensive line of electronic payment solutions including debit and credit card processing, ACH processing, instant funding, and electronic bill payment systems with full IVR, text, and mobile capabilities. REPAY is looking for an experienced Full Stack Developer (Python) to be part of our Agile and growing software development team in expanding our core payment processing platform and products within the consumer finance industry. Work in a small team, where you will have an immediate and measurable impact on our fast-growing business by helping us reach the next level and stage of growth. Here, we work hard—but we have lots of fun doing it. So, if you like a cool, collaborative, and challenging work environment, you’ll fit right in. REPAY’s Tech Stack: * Python 3.x           * Pyramid * React                     * React Native * AWS                      * Redux * Docker * Postgres              * External APIs: Twilio, SendGrid, and other You’ll be responsible for: * Building and enhancing our core API, user interfaces, and backend processing systems via new greenfield development and supporting legacy systems * Integrating with existing corporate and partner applications which span multiple languages and frameworks * Developing high performance and reusable software with excellent test coverage * Developing and deploying to cloud-based technology (AWS) * Participate in the design of our core products * Evaluating existing and new technologies and ensuring our applications utilize industry best practices * Supporting the operations team in order to provide the best uptime and service quality * Occasional travel to Tempe, AZ for remote employees Skills & Requirements: * Experience working with Python (3.x), Django and/or Pyramid * Experience with building highly available systems * Experience working with JavaScript * A track record of success with developing modern APIs * Good understanding of application security * Comfortable working in off-hours on-call rotation program Preferred Skills & Requirements: * Experience leading projects/initiatives * Experience with Kubernetes * AWS knowledge * Good understanding of Payments processing and/or developing Payments products * Familiarity of PCI compliance * Relational database experience using Postgres * DevOps/Infrastructure experience

items.content:
Modus Create

Full Stack Engineer

Hello! Are you ready to Work from Home and transform your career? We're looking for a Full Stack Javascript Engineer to join the engineering team at Modus. Want to help our client’s build awesome solutions to accomplish their goals and vision? Are you interested in working from home with some of the best talent on the planet? Then keep reading. About You You love building great software. Your work could be supporting new feature development, migrating existing features, or creating APIs. You a skilled Javascript engineer and are comfortable diving into any of the frameworks. Our client’s tech stacks typically include React, Angular, Node.js, Ionic, Vue, and GraphQL. We use modern tools, which means you’ll have the opportunity to work with software like Webpack, Redux, Apollo, Styled Components, AWS and other cloud platforms. You have worked with teams before on large and demonstrable projects. You’re also familiar with many Javascript frameworks and modern tools.  You understand server side languages. You understand Agile software development, DevOps practices, and can work closely with QA teams to optimize your code.   You relish creating high quality code from the comfort of your own home. Your engineering projects will focus on understanding customers' needs and translating those needs from product specifications into functional, production ready code. You'll have the opportunity to ship code daily that will be used by customers. You love learning. Engineering is an ever-evolving world. You enjoy playing with new tech and exploring areas that you might not have experience with yet.  You are self-driven, self-learner willing to share knowledge and participate actively in your community. Having overlap with your team is critical when working in a global remote team. Modus requires all team members to overlap with EST morning hours daily. In addition, reliable high speed internet is a must. Things You Might Do Modus is a fast-growing, and remote-first company, so you'll likely get experience on many different projects across the organization. That said, here are some things you'll probably do: * Give back to the community via open source and blog posts * Travel and meet great people- as part of our remote-first lifestyle, it's important that we come together as needed to work together, meet each other in person and have fun together. Please keep that in mind when you apply. * Teach and be taught: Modus creates active teams that work in internal and external projects together, giving opportunities to stay relevant with the latest technologies and learning from experts worldwide * Interact directly with internal and external clients to represent Modus and its values Why Modus Create: Our Benefits may vary according to the Country you are located in, so please reach out to our recruiter in case you have any questions. If you live in Romania and you become a full time employee at our office we offer: * Competitive compensation * Medical insurance * Bookster subscription, gym reimbursement * Possibility to work from home * The chance to work side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech Do you have what it takes? Apply today! About Modus Modus Create is a digital product agency that accelerates digital transformation. We use high performing small teams, emerging technology, and “new school” product development tools and methods to accelerate business outcomes. We support our clients across four core delivery areas: business and product strategy consulting, customer experience, cloud services, and Agile software delivery.  Driven by a team of world-class talent, we have been recognized by the Inc. 5000 list of fastest growing private companies 5 years in a row, the Washington Business Journal list of Fastest Growing Companies in the Washington, DC area two years in a row, and a top company for remote work by FlexJobs. We’re also an official partner to Atlassian, AWS, Cloudflare, GitHub, InVision, Ionic Framework, and Vue.js! Based on the model of an open source team, Modites work remotely, and are located across the globe. That’s allowed us to hire the best talent in the world, no matter where they live. Our highly collaborative, autonomous, and effective working environment is fueled by a team unified by a love of continuous learning. Our years of thought leadership including books, whitepapers, blog posts, conference and MeetUp talks, demonstrate our commitment to sharing what we’ve learned.  We encourage every Modus employee to do the same. Our company is a platform for the growth of our employees. Through working with our distributed team of experts on challenging projects, every person that joins the Modus team can expect to continue growing and learning every day. This is your chance to be part of building something great.

items.content:
Jack Henry & Associates .�

 

Senior Javascript Engineer

Banno is redefining the relationship between forward-thinking financial institutions and their customers. Banno leverages bleeding edge technology and an industry leading product vision to make user-friendly mobile and web apps. We build front end applications using modern web components. About You You are infinitely curious and thrive in an environment where you are constantly learning and growing. You want to be somewhere that you are trusted and set up for success every day. You want to be somewhere that surrounds you with other great engineers that drive you to be better everyday. Although you work in a team you are self motivated and able to work with independence. You want to own the deliverable from working with the product manager to define the scope all the way through supporting your work in production. You care deeply about your work, your team, and the end user. Banno values trust and those with a bias towards action. We have a remote-first culture that challenges you each day and supports your growth. We are confident you will love it here. What you and your team are working on The JavaScript Engineer plans, participates and works with our team on a suite of single page applications in close cooperation with our product design and API teams. JavaScript Engineers are constantly keeping our apps up-to-date with the newest development practices to offer exciting user experiences for highly secured data. About the Banno team We are committed to creativity, thoughtfulness, culture, and openness—the perfect place to make phenomenal products that have a big impact. Our work environment echoes a modern tech startup but we have the security and benefits of a large, publicly traded company. With an engineering team of over 100, we place high value on continued education and also contribute to, and use, open source projects. Our team is distributed and that means you can live and work wherever you want–as long as your work hours match US business hours. You’ll get the chance to choose your own tools, work with bleeding edge web technologies across the stack and contribute to products that are used by thousands of people. Travel of up to 5% may be required for company meetings and professional development. Minimum Qualifications * Minimum of six years of programming experience with Javascript. * Experience with at least one modern JavaScript framework such as Angular, React, Vue, or Polymer * Experience building and debugging single page applications * Experience with frontend build systems such webpack or rollup * Experience supporting an application in production Bonus Points * Bachelor's degree in Computer Science is preferred * Experience with continuous integration systems and frontend testing * Experience with Web Components. * Experience working in a team environment, providing meaningful and quality reviews/feedback of peer’s work. * Worked to improve the team’s process and standards while building consensus amongst the team.

items.content:
EverQuote

 

Senior Software Engineer

verified
We are looking for software engineers that love to build well designed systems that can last the test of time, make an impact in day to day operations and life of consumers and agents in the insurance technology space. The Software Engineer will have the opportunity to engage in full stack development, managing k8s infrastructure, visualization, user analytics, distributed systems, docker container based services and machine learning algorithms.  You will be working with reactjs, python, git, webpack, k8s, variety of data stores, continuous integration, GCP, AWS, automated testing, docker and always open to speeding up our development process and scaling our system.  You will also be handling and managing a lot of data to inform the business operations. Your work will constantly be driven by end-user-focused development to enhance consumer and agent experience. You will utilize user engagement data and increase usability. You will also have ample opportunity to refactor, reimplement and drive innovation. In the end, you will have the final responsibility of delivering high quality software that is well tested for the end user’s needs (insurance agents, consumers, operators). We respect people who continuously improve, learn and take pride in delivering software products that people would love to use. You will work closely with the design team, stakeholders to deliver scalable and well designed front end components and backend services.  Qualifications * Proven experience in understanding complex user needs with multiple stakeholders and providing practical solutions that can work in production * Always automating solutions, but making it clearly understandable to other developers and users * Highly collaborative and be able to communicate both interpersonally and in your code (we <3 COMMENTS! and ability to think about future developers) * Not afraid to dive into other’s code, refactor and rewrite if it’s best for maintenance and end user * Eye for good software engineering practices (i.e. experience in dealing with bad code and improving or refactoring with good design) * Experience in designing great API’s * Experience with collaborating in github * Experience in solving SQL performance issues a plus * Experience in creating open source modules or participating in development and packaging of open source modules * Experience in agile sprints a plus * Experience in developing and debugging with javascript and reactjs a plus * Experience working effectively in remote teams * Desire to continuously, learn, improve and apply new technologies that will increase operational efficiency and effectiveness We are in the early stage of building a remote team, and looking for someone who will fit in this role and is excited about making a huge impact in insurance tech, while working in a collegial, highly collaborative environment—replete with many of the latest communication tools (Slack, Hangouts, etc.)—with the flexibility of working from anywhere (we are distributed across Seattle, Boston and Europe) or in our office in Boston. If you are excited to take this partake in the growth of EverQuote and take on this challenge please email at [email protected] with links that demonstrate your work and a resume.

items.content:
Globavista

 

Senior Software Engineers Full Stack Front End Specialists

At Globavista, we are passionate about our technology. For many years we have been fully remote with empowered developers using their unique skills to bring us forward in the maritime marketplace. We are currently growing - in large part due to this ethos. We need smart, passionate people to join us in the next evolution of our highly successful product. In return you will have 100% home working (flexible hours) on a challenging, interesting product with a very competitive salary + benefits. Whilst located in the UK, we are now working with major US vendors so would consider US candidates if they were a good fit. Job Description We are looking for several candidates, there are 2 main roles we will consider, a full-stack and a front-end specialist. We currently have a rich SPA written in AngularJS 1.4+ (with Typescript). This is in the process of being moved over to Angular, so a front-end specialist would be instrumental in driving that forward but also help add new features where necessary to a large complex application. A full stack developer would need AngularJS experience and Angular would be a bonus for that role.  The full-stack developer will have good .NET skills and excellent SQL Server skills as the nature of our application means we deal with millions of ship positions every hour, therefore a full-stack developer needs to understand coding for performance, especially SQL Server performance.  In addition, as we move our architecture forward, someone well versed in NoSQL dbs would be advantageous. We have an ASP.NET MVC website and several services which are in the process of getting containerized. Any full stack engineer that has skills in docker / aws / devops could really make a difference in that area as well. Front-end specialist candidates will have: * AngularJS / Typescript * Angular (front-end specialist only) * Excellent HTML / CSS / LESS or SASS / Bootstrap Front-end specialist desirable skills: * .NET / C# * SQL Server T-SQL Full-stack candidates will have: * AngularJS / Typescript * HTML / CSS / LESS or SASS / Bootstrap * Very good T-SQL (including performance, execution plan analysis etc) Full-stack desirable skills: * Angular * .NET Core * Kafka * Redis * AWS / Docker / Microservices

Ngoar are looking for a Mid-Senior Front-End Developer to join our team. You will work closely with experienced technical architects, team leads and project managers to deliver a range of interesting global projects for well-known brands and companies. The Role  You will be working on enterprise-level software development projects in multiple industries, using languages and technologies such as JavaScript, Node, React, HTML/CSS and more. Working closely with our development teams in the UK, Ukraine, Poland, Serbia and our London-based creatives and management, you will take part in projects from conception through to completion. Who You Are * You are a collaborative individual who is capable of laying aside your own agenda, listening to and learning from colleagues, challenging thoughtfully and prioritising impact * You are naturally enthusiastic and enjoy sharing your passion and ideas with others * You search for ways to improve things, believe in iterative change, experimenting with new approaches, learning and improving to move forward quickly * Able to communicate in English and comfortable working on several projects at the same time What You’ll Need  * Solid knowledge and strong React.js, React Native development skills * At least 3 to 4 years of experience developing React applications * Good knowledge of JavaScript, Node.js, SQL * Proficiency in cross platform HTML development, HTML5 and CSS3 * Solid experience of working in Agile and Scrum environments * Experience of working with remote teams across multiple locations is an advantage In Return You’ll receive an attractive salary with excellent career and personal development opportunities within a fast-paced, growing company. This is a great opportunity to be part of the Ngoar success story and build your career to the next stage. Next Steps If you think you have the skills, experience and ambition we’re looking for, contact us at [email protected]

items.content:
Cloud Academy

 

Senior Front End Engineer

PLEASE NOTE: This is a 100% remote position for candidates located anywhere in Italy, or for candidates outside of Italy who speak fluent Italian.  A trip to our office in Switzerland (expenses paid by the company) one week per quarter, to work onsite with the team, is required. Now is your chance to join our talented team that delivers unparalleled educational content to developers worldwide! We’re looking for a Senior Front-End Developer to help us take our product to the next level. We move seamlessly from full-stack web development, to mobile, to deployment/scaling. This position will take ownership of how features are implemented, from user experience to backend, involving our web app, mobile app, APIs and backend infrastructure. You’ll have an opportunity to make a large impact on the culture of our development team. Our ideal candidate is a humble leader, equally capable of teaching and learning. Responsibilities: * Able to write well-structured, maintainable, idiomatic code with good documentation; unit tests for every feature, bug fixing and code reviews. * Communicate with the rest of the company (e.g. sales, marketing, UX, etc) to ensure the functionality you're implementing is what was intended. * Collaborate in a cross-functional team, including mobile developers, designers and product managers in order to quickly deliver new features. * Work closely with the Operations Team to ensure smooth deployments, ensuring that errors are logged with enough info to debug effectively. Requirements: * Basic CSS3 knowledge * Very proficient in Javascript: ES6, Webpack, React, Redux (React preferred) * Experience with SPA (single page applications) and SSR (server side rendering) with React (or any other modern JS framework) * Experience with atomic design strongly preferred * Experience with distributed version control systems: mostly Git (Github and/or Bitbucket). * Familiar with cloud-oriented technologies: AWS, Google Cloud, Heroku, Docker * Understanding of the appropriate use of the file system, cloud storage, network resources, and an understanding of data redundancy and availability is necessary * Good English level, both spoken and written Bonus Points: * Passion for and experience in e-learning projects is a strong bonus * Ability to find creative solutions to interesting problems
